General ramblings of socal supermoto

MOTYdesign

She’s a little heavy. I mean not much. You like her just the way she is. That said 5lbs off wouldn’t be a bad thing. I mean not that she needs it.

For a long time, I’ve said that the real value in aftermarket exhaust isn’t in the nominal hp gains, it’s in the loss of weight. Especially when that weight is up high and weighs 25 pds! (dr650 anyone?). As soon as you get on the bike, the seat of the pants dyno tells you that the bike has more power, or atleast feels more responsive. I’m sure there’s a bit of a placebo effect going on here, but it’s not all that difficult to believe when you just lopped 10lbs off your bike. Generally speaking when it comes to performance mods, spending $400 to loose anywhere from 5-20lbs from your stock exhaust system is considered a deal. Now just loose the passenger pegs, fairings, turn signals, stock mirrors, big ol’ lic plate fender thing and you’re in business!

There’s another cheap way to lop a ton of weight off your bike. After my battery went dead last year I replaced it with a MOTY Design battery (Mod Of The Year). The 4 cell only weighs 11.9 oz. Stock Batteries tend to weight somewhere between 6-10lbs. Which means you’re looking at a solid 5-9lb weight savings, all for an additional $10-$60 cost over the price of replacing your stocker. In other words, smokin deal when looking at the price per pound lost.

Admittedly after spending 20 years with big bulky motorcycle batteries it was a bit difficult to trust this tiny little thing that looks like it belongs in a RC car. The battery is a little bigger than my iphone. It’s a weird feeling trusting the thing is gonna start your bike/get you home. I no longer have any doubts. My newbies stall the bike…..a lot. With my old batteries I’d have to sometimes bump start the bike mid lesson as a result. In the past I’ve also destroyed batteries, either through vibes, crashes, or jumping. So far the moty has performed flawlessly while taking a ton of abuse. Per Brian at Moty for bikes over 600cc go for the 8cell, For everything else the 4cell will do it.

They’ve stood up to socal supermoto abuse which is saying a lot. MOTYdesign also sponsors Graves Motorsports and is used in their racebikes. Speaking of, this looks like that guy who rides supermoto at adams. Guess he decided to try sportbikes…

As you know we don’t have a lot of sponsors and the reason is simple. Generally speaking for my business sponsors are more trouble than their worth in terms of time/energy. We make an exception when it’s a product we’re genuinely excited about, ie Sidi boots and now MOTYdesign batteries. So next time you’re ready for a battery I’d take a serious look at MOTYdesign. Or forget the look and just buy the thing. It’s such a cool feeling tossing out your giant stocker, and installying (”install” per MOTY, “zip tie” per me) the small moty in. You’ll dig it. Tell em Socal Supermoto sent you and they’ll hook you up with the pimpy one in the picture which includes a volt meter! (just don’t try to take it on a plane)
